website_summaries.verdict: If you've tossed out other slicers because they've aggravated joint problems, give this one a try.
pros: Quickly slices apples and pears into eight wedges
Cover is used to pop wedges out and protects blade during storage
Made of ABS, stainless steel, and polypropylene
Blade cover attaches to slicer so it doesn't get lost
Works well for people with hand dexterity problems
cons: Can be difficult to get all the small apple shavings out of the bottom of the slicer

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Sturdy and Long-Lasting
customer_reviews.text: Here's a review from somebody that wasn't compensated and paid full price! While this slicer is plastic and might not look like the strongest product ever offered, it has surprised me by taking on not only tons of eggs but also any fruit and mushrooms we have thrown at it. It has always been thrown in the dishwasher and it still looks almost new. I would recommend that, for fruit and mushrooms, go slow when applying the cut. I think that's key to getting this thing to last...and that's still better and faster than trying to do the same cuts with a knife.
customer_reviews.author: KoHoSo

customer_reviews.title: Best tool I've ever used to slice deviled eggs in half
customer_reviews.text: The only egg-slicer I've found that can slice an egg in half for deviled eggs. The thin wire makes such a nicer, cleaner, faster cut than I've ever been able to do with a knife. I highly recommend it, with one caveat. It's not as easy or as fast to use as it could be, because while it looks like the slicing discs are guided by the sides of the base, the slicing discs cut into the top of the egg before they engage the slots, so you have to carefully eyeball the alignment. If you could slide the disk into the guides before it made contact with the egg, I would have given this five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Peter K Sheerin

customer_reviews.title: Very clever design
customer_reviews.text: This apple slicer is very cleverly designed. What sets this guy apart is the attached cover. When the cover is rotated under the sliced apple, just press down and all the slices and core are removed from the blades. Really convenient. It's apple season in the NE. We are members of CSA, Consumer Supported Agriculture, and apples of all varieties are delivered every week. Have used this slicer for over two dozen apples thus far, without fail. I am an accomplished home cook who collects all kinds of kitchen gizmos, many of which turn out to be clear failures (herb stripper comes to mind). This gizmo is somewhat of a game changer and certainly worth 10 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: RJC

customer_reviews.title: Cute. Util.
customer_reviews.text: I really don't need a gadget for every food item to prepare, yet THIS ONE is right on track: 3 functions (half egg, six pieces or slices) or even COMBINING a few you completely get CHOPPED eggs for your salad, I just love this little devise. (Don't know about strawberries nor mushrooms.. hence it DOES NEED TO BE SOFT to work out!). enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Love2Earth: I mean IT

customer_reviews.title: Great for strawberries!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for strawberries. It is so much faster than cutting them up one by one did 2 lbs in half the time it would normally take. This thing is awesome! Buying one for all of the family members to go with christmas gifts. Also works for kiwis too!
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the one this company made "back in the day."
customer_reviews.text: This does not slice/dice all in one clean swoop the way I like my eggs chopped for egg salad sandwich mix. It would seem to be more efficient, but cutting into wedges and slices are all it does and who wants parts that need to be assembled each time, or searched for in a drawer? A one-piece operation with a variety of cuts is what I had and hoped to replace after using it for more than 20 years! Same company, just not the same quality. made into this style.
customer_reviews.author: PeggyO

customer_reviews.title: Did what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: This product did exactly what it was supposed to do. The only negative comment I will make is that I don't like how the blade cover is attached. It didn't necessarily get in my way (because I was conscious of it), but I would have preferred a detached blade cover. However, this came in handy this past Thanksgiving while making apple pies and apple crisp. I was able to core and slice 12+ apples in the time I would have finished about 3. It saved so much time and it is super easy to use! Overall, I'm happy with this purchase and you can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: G.B.

customer_reviews.title: Don't
customer_reviews.text: Useless. The bottom part doesn't disconnect at all!! No way to actually slice the Apple with the core in the correct position. Did nobody test this before manufacturing?!

customer_reviews.title: Great slicer till....
customer_reviews.text: Hello - anyone know how to contact the distributor? I love this slicer and literally use it everyday - the red slicer is what I use and now it's broken. The wire at both ends came out of the plastic and I'd lover to know how to purchase another one. I've tried other slicers but they seem to crush my eggs - not clean slices like this one does.
customer_reviews.author: 28paws

customer_reviews.title: A game changer!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know that an apple slicer can be this amazing! I no longer have to fight to get the apple slices out of the slicer and rip them apart. The bottom of this slicer pushes the slices through which separates them. Mind blown! And as a bonus, the bottom protects the blade while being stored. It just keeps getting better!

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't handle very large apples

customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Perfect apple slicer!
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy with this apple slicer! It solves the main problems with ones I have used. It is sharp enough to slice through hard apples, big enough for even larger apples, and best of all, it has the added feature of a flip cover to push the rest of way through without risking your fingers! The apple and core pop right up when you flip the cover underneath and give it one more press down.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn S

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic buy
customer_reviews.text: Those who think the blade isn't sharp enough need to check the freshness of the fruit they're trying to slice. The older the apple/pear/etc., the tougher the peel. If you have old fruit, try using a paring knife and put a small slit where the blades will hit. May take a little longer, but still enables you to cut all the way through with and core it at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Am I actually writing a review for an apple slicer? Yes I am.
customer_reviews.text: I kind of can't believe I'm writing a review for an APPLE SLICER, but here we are. This thing is just awesome. So simple but such a difference from my other one, which was the kind probably 90% of people who even have apple slicers have. Tearing the slices off the remainder of the apple, smooshing the core through it, all that's a thing of the past! This just works great - sharp, the slices and core practically fall out, quick soapy rinse and back in the drawer it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Dulls quickly - worth it?
customer_reviews.text: We use it weekly and liked it at first. In less than 6 months the cutting "edge" dulled to the point where we now resort to literally wacking / throwing down the apple on a cutting board to get it to cut through. We do love the pop out of the slices feature and that still is good. Feels not made to last and therefore why spend the extra money?

customer_reviews.title: Solid product

customer_reviews.author: Linda  Scribner

customer_reviews.title: The wires are way too flimsy for the intended use- cutting eggs.

I used this slicer on EGGS twice, before I lost a wire. Unhappy, I cut that wire off and continued using it. Then another wire snapped. We are talking hard boiled eggs here. Nothing too taxing. customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: Best apple slicer ever!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for. It solves the problem of going all the way through apple. Just turn the apple upside down and use the push plate to finish the cut. Simple to use and easy to clean. Highly recommended.

customer_reviews.title: This cuts the apple into 8 pieces which is great for a big apple

But we find that if you use the Cuisipro Apple corer first for either the whole process is a snap. customer_reviews.title: Awesome, but leaves a bit of the core.

customer_reviews.title: Great kitchen gadget!

I would, without hesitation rerecommend this product to a friend or family member.

I used this cutter recently, and the apple even got stuck. On top of that, my apple slices looked so unproper; this is suppose to make people's lives more easier, not harder by trying to figure out how to use this item. Make it nice and simple.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product
customer_reviews.text: I love this apple slicer. When used as directed, it cuts cleanly through the apple and removes the entire core. The blades are not exposed during storage and it is stainless steel so it will not rust. Worth every penny!

customer_reviews.title: Better than our old one!

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat to my surprise, this works for me
customer_reviews.text: Somewhat to my surprise, this has worked well for me - my hands aren't very strong, but with enough effort I can bring the working edge down on an apple and end up with nice even wedges plus a core. Quickly slice apples and pears with this easy-to-use Wedge and Pop kitchen tool by Prep Works for Progressive International. The handy gadget not only slices an apple or pear into eight tidy wedges, but it also pops the fruit out in one fast motion. Just push down, swing the unit's cover under the fruit and pop the wedges out. Both the wedges and the core come out cleanly and effortlessly. Made of durable ABS, stainless steel and polypropylene, the Wedge and Pop measures approximately 5.25 by 7.25 by 2 Inch and can safely go in the dishwasher to ensure thorough cleaning between use.
